metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:interface_test probe is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:interface_test probe.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

Information regarding the interfaces on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start->Settings->Network Connections. The interfaces on your machine should be listed under the 'LAN or High-Speed Internet' section. Additional information about a particular interface can be found by right-clicking an interface and selecting 'Status', then clicking on the 'Support' tab, and then lastly click the 'Details...' button.

criterion.comment: Test that an interface_object with a name is supported.
Test that an interface_object with a name pattern match is supported.
Test that an interface_object with a name not equals is supported.

interface_test.comment: Test that an interface_object with a name is supported.
Test that an interface_object with a name pattern match is supported.
Test that an interface_object with a name not equals is supported.

interface_object.comment: Retrieve the interface object with a name equal to 'MS TCP Loopback interface'.
interface_object.name: MS TCP Loopback interface

interface_object.comment: Retrieve the interface objects with names that match the regular expression 'MS TCP Loopback .*'.
interface_object.name: MS TCP Loopback .*

interface_object.comment: Retrieve the interface objects with names that do not equal 'MS TCP Loopback interface'.
interface_object.name: MS TCP Loopback interface

interface_state.comment: This state represents an interface with a name of 'MS TCP Loopback interface', an index greater than or equal to '0', a type that matches the regular expression '.*', an IP address of '127.0.0.1', a broadcast address of '127.255.255.255', a subnet mask of '255.0.0.0', and a address type that matches the regular expression '.*'.
interface_state.name: MS TCP Loopback interface

interface_state.comment: This state represents an interface with a name that matches the regular expression '.*', an index greater than or equal to '0', a type that matches the regular expressionnot '.*', a MAC address that matches the regular expression '.*', an IP address that matches the regular expression '.*', a broadcast address that matches the regular expression '.*', a subnet mask that matches the regular expression '.*', and an address type that matches the regular expression '.*'.

constant_variable.comment: This variable utilizes the work-around to use the pattern match operation on an enumeration. This variable is referenced in the state 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:357', 'oval:org.mitre.oval.test:ste:890'
